sentences.english: I will clothe the heavens with darkness, and will make sackcloth their covering.
sentences.chinese: 我可使黑暗籠罩諸天，使麻衣掩蔽天際。

sentences.english: The noise occultation was significant, and the undertone was the easiest one to be occulted.
sentences.chinese: 噪音對信號的掩蔽作用顯著，其中低音最易被掩蔽。

sentences.english: The noise occultation was significant, and the undertone was the easiest one to be occulted.
sentences.chinese: 噪音對信號的掩蔽作用顯著，其中低音最易被掩蔽。

sentences.english: If you are using a brush for painting , the kind of masking tape that you choose can be important.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是用油漆刷，那種錄音帶，您可以掩蔽重要。

sentences.english: The mound can be used as our screen.
sentences.chinese: 這個土丘可做我們的掩蔽物。

sentences.english: The soldier looped a grenade into the enemy shelter trench.
sentences.chinese: 士兵將一枚手榴彈呈弧形拋進敵方掩蔽壕裏。

sentences.english: Darkness was blacking out both sea and jungle .
sentences.chinese: 暮靄漸漸掩蔽了海洋和叢林。

sentences.english: A shower of rocks and stones rattled on the roof of the dug-out.
sentences.chinese: 一陣巖塊和石子劈劈啪啪地打在掩蔽部的頂上。

sentences.english: Raid shelter an area of 8500 square meters, two-story building.
sentences.chinese: 掩蔽部佔地8500平方米，爲二層建築物。

sentences.english: We used branches and leaves to form a shelter.
sentences.chinese: 我們用樹枝和樹葉建造成一個掩蔽所。

sentences.english: There are few researches in the shield effect on ice force been reported in the world.
sentences.chinese: 國內外尚無人對冰力掩蔽效應進行專門研究。

sentences.english: The idea that these trees could also provide shelter and lookout positions had never occurred to them.
sentences.chinese: 他們從未想過這些樹木也可以作爲掩蔽處和警戒哨。

sentences.english: The relevant units shall be responsible for constructing works for sheltering their own employees, goods and materials.
sentences.chinese: 有關單位負責修建本單位的人員與物資掩蔽工程。

sentences.english: Can it shelter all of them?
We hid our patients in the shelter during the war.
sentences.chinese: 戰爭年代我們把傷病員藏在掩蔽部。

sentences.english: This makes a screen so their enemies can't see them slip away.
sentences.chinese: 這樣製造一個掩蔽物好讓它們的敵人看不見他們躲開。

definition: to cover/to hide from view/to obstruct or block/defilade (military)
to hide/to conceal and avoid (contact)/to keep sth concealed
to conceal oneself/to go into hiding/to take cover
to cut off/to interrupt/to prevent access
to hide/to go into hiding/to take refuge
